main.name: Yang Zhou
main.description: I like building things with web technology. I studied Petroleum Engineering during college and later found out my interest in coding. Scroll down to checkout more about my learning journey as a developer
main.nowadays: I am a recent graduate from Code Platoon, a chicago based coding institution with a mission to help military members navigate in IT industry. At Code Platoon, I learnt how to develop full-stack web application using Django and React.
history: At 15, I started attending an internatioanl high school in Nanjing, China.
At 18, I graduated from high school and came to America on my own for the first time to attend college.
At 19, I transferred to University of Oklahoma because the public school tuition made a lot more sense to me.
At 21, I started my first-ever job as a Undergraduate Researched at University of Oklahoma.
At 23, I swore in to join the United States Army because I love the military lifestyle
19 - 24, I powered through undergraduate & graduate school in Oklahoma and graduated with honors. I also partied a lot and made many life-long friends
At 25, I was called into active duty to be trained as a Biomedical Equipment Specialist for the Army in San Antonio, Texas.

At 26, I completed my training from the Army as the Honor Grad and started working for Philips Healthcare in New York. In the same year, I enrolled in Harvard Extension Schhol to formalize my learning as a software developer.
At 27, I quit my job at Philips Healthcare and enrolled at Code Platoon to learn full-stack web development.
main.contactmessage: Send me a message, this will go directly to my email inbox and I check it everyday.

resume.skillmessage: Here are the coding languages, frameworks and tools I am familiar with.

education.description: Fully online curriculum focusing on [Machine Learning](https://www.cs.utexas.edu/graduate-program/masters-program/online-option/courses) by the nation's Top 5-ranked program, enabling myself to learn at my own pace.

Over 600 hours of immersive [Full-Stack Software Engineering](https://www.codeplatoon.org/the-program/course-curriculum/#top) training. I learnt build web application from scratch using React and Django.

* [CSCI E-31 Web Application Development using Node.js](https://www.extension.harvard.edu/course-catalog/courses/web-application-development-using-nodejs/25038)
 * [CSCI S-25 Image Processing and Computer Vision](https://www.summer.harvard.edu/course-catalog/courses/image-processing-and-computer-vision/34835)
Graduated with honors from the nation's top-5 Petroleum Engineering programs

work.title: Biomedical Equipment Specialist
work.description: Provide preventative maintenance and repaired hundreds of various medical equipment used to support military healthcare workers in critical missions all over the world

work.title: Field Service Engineer
work.description: Performed preventive maintenance, repairs, tests and calibrations on a wide variety of equipment for over 500 clinics in New York Metro Area. Also participated in setting up emergency hospitals during COVID-19 crisis in NY

work.title: Waiter
work.description: Waiting tables at a popular Thai restaurtant at the heart of the college town. It was fun during the football seasons.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: I spent a lot of time in the engineering lab performing rock-mechanics experiments and collecting data. I then used Matlab to do analysis on them to support ongoing researches. My graduate thesis was based on the experiments I performed.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Teaching graduate level classes, grading homework and hosting office hours for students. This was actually pretty fun, I got to see what it was like on the other side of the classroom.

projects.title: Dog Breed Classifier
projects.category: Deep learning model identifying dog breed from image

projects.title: PhotoApp
projects.category: A hub for users to register/login and share their photos

projects.title: Snow Mountain Checker
projects.category: Interactive map app with all Epic pass snow mountains, allowing users to check weather and make comments

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
